title: Donadea Forest Walk Route

images.title: buzzard525, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Donadea Castle. In 1558 the Aylmer family acquired the manor. In 1581, Gerald Aylmer commenced a new tower in Donadea which was not completed until 1624. After the death of the last of the Aylmers, Miss Caroline, in 1935, the property was bequeathed to the Church of Ireland, which subsequently sold it to the State.

images.title: buzzard525, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The site boasts a 2.3-hectare (5.7-acre) lake, home to ducks and other birds, with a spectacular display of water lilies during the summer months. The park's drainage system incorporates walled streams.

images.title: Sheila1988, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Donadea Tower

images.caption: 9-11 memorial at Donadea Park

images.title: buzzard525, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Dr Charles Nelson / Donadea; gate to the Castle garden.
images.caption: Gate to the Castle garden. These gates are signed by Richard Turner, the Dublin ironmaster, who built the Great Palm House at Kew.

description: This circular loop walk explores the popular Donadea Forest in the northern part of County Kildare. The woods include some pleasant walking trails taking you through mixed woodland to a pretty lake. The site is located on the historic Aylmer family estate with remaining features including the remains of the castle, walled gardens, church, tower, ice house, boat house and a picturesque Lime Tree Avenue. You can reach Donadea in just over an hour's drive west of Dublin.
